ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would summarize Latin 390 as a truly excellent course taught by a truly excellent professor. I would recommend it both to those interested in Latin specifically and to those interested in language more generally. The compositions, assigned readings, and "little talks" (given weekly about a variety of subjects related to the Latin language and its change over time) were a lot of fun.
Only take it if you absolutely have to. Hours upon hours of work and too many pop quizzes

Latin 390 is a course in the history of Latin and Latin prose style (the "stylistics" in the course title). The assignments for the class have almost no bearing on this subject - they're prose compositions from Bradley's Arnold, a 19th-century textbook which desperately needs a 21st-century update. These teach you the "syntax" in the course title.Taking prose composition classes like Greek 390 and Latin 390 is a great way to improve your reading speed and fluency in ancient languages. After taking this class, I was able to read Latin about twice as fast as I had before; I think this is mostly the result of studying Bradley's Arnold closely and spending a lot of time on the compositions. This was worth the substantial time and effort the class took, and I would encourage anyone planning to do 2 or more semesters of L5 Latin (or to do research that requires Latin) to take this course. It will be a good experience, albeit not a fun one.

Latin 390 is both a prose composition course and a stylistic review of Latin literature from its beginnings to Tacitus. I'm not going to major in the Classics, but I nevertheless quite enjoyed this course. If you are really interested in writing in Latin and understanding Latin a good deal better, I would recommend this course, though it is a lot of work, since the compositions take a long time.
